learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an advanced understanding of occupational therapy services in a specialist area.
Apply a client-centred and occupation-centred approach to clinical service provision.
Integrate and apply information from relevant legislative and organisational contexts.
Apply systematic clinical reasoning, and theory-informed and evidence-informed practice, within a clinical service.
Articulate skills and knowledge using professional communication.
Develop key skills that support employability.

assessments.assessment_title: Employment Simulation Series Assessment - Submission 1 - Job Application
assessments.due_date:
Submission 1 of Employment Simulation Series Assessment. 20/08/2025 5:00 pm

Submit assignment via Blackboard link.
assessments.task_description:
This first submission for the employment simulation series assessment is a job application (due in Week 4 - August 20th, 5pm, worth 15%). Students will complete a simulated job application for a generic graduate occupational therapy position, including a letter addressing selection criteria and resume. A job application package including advertisement and selection criteria will be provided to students on blackboard.

Note: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Employment Simulation Series Assessment - Submission 2 - Job interview
assessments.due_date:
Submission 2 of the Employment Simulation Series Assessment. 27/10/2025 - 30/10/2025

Week 13
assessments.task_description:
This second submission for the employment simulation series assessment is a job interview (completed in Week 13, worth 30%). This simulation will be timetabled over three days (each student attends one half-hour exam). Students will complete a job interview simulation for a specialist position in the area of practice of their specialist stream. A separate job application advertisement and selection criteria will be provided to each stream on Blackboard. 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

Assessment Procedure (95) When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be assessed on their clinical performance and professional behaviours using the OCTY4208 Clinical Performance Assessment (based on the domains of the Student Placement Evaluation Form - Revised 2). This will be based on clinical performance during placement experiences, including clinical discussion and debriefing in tutorials and reflections provided by students. Other written documents related to clinical services, including assessment or intervention plans, progress notes, etc, may be needed within a stream as relevant to the clinical area, and will be considered in evaluation of a student's clinical performance. The Stream Coordinator/Clinical Educator will provide information on these tasks, including the due date for each. There are no task sheets for these tasks, as they are considered part of clinical practice, rather than discrete assessment items.

Under no circumstances should identifiable clinical information be uploaded to open or external AI platforms, as it is unethical and irresponsible. Given this assessment is related to a placement with clinical information please see more information on use of AI in student placements under additional assessment information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assessment completed by the clinical educator/s throughout the placement.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date: Your stream coordinator or clinical educator will advise regarding the due dates for the first and second draft of the report as relevant to your placement.
assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to complete a clinical report that is relevant to the placement you complete in this course. The report should be aimed at the intended audience for that clinical area (clarify with your clinical educator who is the key audience for your reports). Further guidelines regarding the structure and content of these reports will be provided by your clinical educator or stream coordinator on blackboard.

Students will submit a draft report for feedback from your clinical educator or stream coordinator. You will then respond to this feedback and submit a second draft. The due date for the draft report will be provided by your stream coordinator according to when in the semester you complete your fieldwork. Both drafts are considered in assigning your mark for this assessment.

The length of the report submitted for assessment will be depend on the type of report submitted and the clinical stream.

If the report is to be sent to a real client or organisation, the student is required to finalise the report to the standard required by the stream coordinator/clinical educator and this forms a component of the student's clinical performance.

Under no circumstances should identifiable clinical information be uploaded to open or external AI platforms, as it is unethical and irresponsible. Given this assessment is related to a placement with clinical information please see more information on use of AI in student placements under additional assessment information.

learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Three lectures in the first three weeks of semester will focus on theory-informed practice, the job application process and the ethical use of Artificial Intelligence in clinical practice. Another lecture in Week 11 will focus on working in the National Disability Insurance Scheme and a lecture in Week 12 will focus on job interview simulation preparation.

learning_activities.topic:
Clinical placement in speciality area

Students will undertake approximately 30-40 hours of placement , which may include direct service provision to clients, simulation, case discussion and follow up tasks relevant to the client service. Your placement will involve typical clinical placement activities, including reflections. Reflections will be due at a time that is most relevant to the clinical activities in which you are involved. Some placements will include intervention plans and progress notes or other observational clinical notes to be completed on a regular basis as required by the service within which the placement is completed. These activities are considered part of your clinical responsibilities, not discrete assessment tasks, and therefore do not have a task sheet. Instead, requirements for these activities will be explained by your clinical educator/stream coordinator.
